title: New Arsenal arrival confirmed as Mikel Arteta handed fresh boost in pursuit of dominance
body_text:
New Arsenal arrival confirmed as Mikel Arteta handed fresh boost in pursuit of dominance
Thomas Gronnemark has confirmed that he is now working at Arsenal.
Reports first emerged earlier this week that the Gunners had brought in arguably the world’s leading throw-in expert as they look to further maximise their formidable set-piece prowess, having already become prolific from corners under specialist coach Nicolas Jover.
And Gronnemark has now publicly confirmed his new role at the Emirates Stadium, writing on social media platform X on Tuesday: “It’s out. Yes, I coach Arsenal. Both in the “Long, Fast and Clever throw-in”. No more comments at the moment.”
Dane Gronnemark previously spent five years as throw-in coach at Liverpool during the reign of Jurgen Klopp and had most recently been working at Brentford, initially under current Tottenham boss Thomas Frank.
It’s out. Yes, I coach Arsenal.
Both in the “Long, Fast and Clever throw-in ⚽️ No more comments at the moment.#arsenal #premierleague #championsleague #throwincoach #thomasgronnemark pic.twitter.com/XvkVDu6Cop— Thomas Gronnemark (@ThomasThrowin) January 13, 2026
Before moving to the Premier League, he worked with a number of clubs in his native Denmark including Viborg, FC Midtjylland, Silkeborg and Horsens.
Prior to his football career, Gronnemark, who previously held the world record for the longest-ever throw-in, was a sprinter and later a member of the Danish bobsled team.
Arteta will hope that he can give Arsenal yet another decisive edge as they continue to fight for trophies on four different fronts this season.
The Gunners currently sit top of the Premier League table, six points clear of both closest challengers Manchester City and Aston Villa ahead of Saturday’s trip to Nottingham Forest.
Arsenal beat London rivals Chelsea 3-2 in the pulsating first leg of their blockbuster Carabao Cup semi-final tie on Wednesday night, having also brushed aside Championship opposition in Portsmouth on Sunday to reach the fourth round of the FA Cup, where they will host League One side Wigan next month.
Arteta’s men also occupy top spot in the league phase table in the Champions League, winning six out of six games so far, conceding only one goal and scoring 17.
They are three points ahead of second-place Bayern Munich, with final league phase fixtures to come against Inter Milan and debutants Kairat Almaty in January.
